metadata.subject: Trump Stands by 'Fantastic' Kavanaugh as He Seeks G.O.P. Votes

relationships.description: Trump supporting Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination despite sexual assault allegations
Ford accusing Kavanaugh of sexual assault during high school party
Ramirez accusing Kavanaugh of exposing himself at Yale University party

analysis.purpose: To report on Trump's public defense of Brett Kavanaugh amid sexual assault allegations and his comments on various political matters
analysis.significance: Documents Trump's stance during a critical Supreme Court nomination process with multiple sexual misconduct allegations

notable_quotes: "This went 36 years without a complaint" - Trump questioning Christine Blasey Ford's allegations
"I want her to have her voice. Let her have her voice, let her say whatever she has to say" - Trump on allowing Ford to testify
"I'm not, because I'm an honest guy. And that stuff is unrelated to me" - Trump on Michael Cohen cooperating with Mueller
red_flags: Dismissal of sexual assault allegations without investigation
Contradiction in Trump's statement about Michael Cohen's actions being 'unrelated' when court documents showed Trump directed payments

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this news article

illegal_activity.description: This is a news article reporting on political events and allegations, not first-hand evidence of illegal activity

details: References to New Yorker story about Deborah Ramirez
References to New York Times report about Rod Rosenstein

public_knowledge.context: This was major national news coverage during the Kavanaugh Supreme Court confirmation process in 2018

analysis.summary: President Trump publicly defended Brett Kavanaugh against sexual assault allegations from Christine Blasey Ford and Deborah Ramirez, calling the accusations 'totally political' while acknowledging he would need nearly all Republican votes for confirmation. The article also covers Trump's comments on Rod Rosenstein, Michael Cohen, and his handling of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico.
